medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in his usual state of health until the morning two days prior to presentation, when he developed worsening epigastric pain. He presented to the ED with epigastric pain and was treated with a GI cocktail, which significantly improved the patient's pain. He was discharged home. Yesterday, the patient developed worsening abdominal pain more focal to the right upper quadrant, accompanied by anorexia. The RUQ pain worsened this morning, leading to a return to the ED. The patient denies fevers, chills, chest pain, shortness of breath, unexplained weight loss, diarrhea, bright red blood per rectum, melena, and urinary symptoms.
